intro: Lippia adoensis var. koseret, commonly known as the Koseret lippia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. It has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
